CARDINAL . Physical force in respect of detainees may be employed in order to put an end to their misconduct or resistance to legitimate orders of detention officers if non - forceful alternatives are not feasible ( section CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Rubber truncheons may be used in respect of detainees in the following circumstances ( section CARDINAL ) :
( CARDINAL ) to put an end to an assault by the detainee on detention officers ;
( CARDINAL ) to suppress mass uprisings or collective breaches of public order ;
( CARDINAL ) to put an end to misconduct by the detainee in resisting the legitimate orders of detention officers ;
( CARDINAL ) to free hostages ;
( CARDINAL ) to put an end to the detainee 's attempt to escape ; or
( CARDINAL ) to put an end to the detainee 's attempt to cause harm to others .
